result.namespace_description: List issues assigned to the authenticated user

fields.name: filter
fields.description:
Indicates which sorts of issues to return. Can be one of:
* assigned: Issues assigned to you
* created: Issues created by you
* mentioned: Issues mentioning you
* subscribed: Issues you're subscribed to updates for
* all or repos: All issues the authenticated user can see, regardless of participation or creationDefault: assigned

fields.name: state
fields.description: Indicates the state of the issues to return. Can be either open, closed, or all.Default: open

fields.name: labels
fields.description: A list of comma separated label names. Example: bug,ui,@high

fields.name: sort
fields.description: What to sort results by. Can be either created, updated, comments.Default: created

fields.name: direction
fields.description: One of asc (ascending) or desc (descending).Default: desc

fields.name: since
fields.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

result.namespace_description: List organization issues assigned to the authenticated user

fields.name: filter
fields.description:
Indicates which sorts of issues to return. Can be one of:
* assigned: Issues assigned to you
* created: Issues created by you
* mentioned: Issues mentioning you
* subscribed: Issues you're subscribed to updates for
* all or repos: All issues the authenticated user can see, regardless of participation or creationDefault: assigned

fields.name: state
fields.description: Indicates the state of the issues to return. Can be either open, closed, or all.Default: open

fields.name: labels
fields.description: A list of comma separated label names. Example: bug,ui,@high

fields.name: sort
fields.description: What to sort results by. Can be either created, updated, comments.Default: created

fields.name: direction
fields.description: One of asc (ascending) or desc (descending).Default: desc

fields.name: since
fields.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

fields.name: milestone
fields.description: If an integer is passed, it should refer to a milestone by its number field. If the string * is passed, issues with any milestone are accepted. If the string none is passed, issues without milestones are returned.

fields.name: state
fields.description: Indicates the state of the issues to return. Can be either open, closed, or all.Default: open

fields.name: assignee
fields.description: Can be the name of a user. Pass in none for issues with no assigned user, and * for issues assigned to any user.

fields.name: creator
fields.description: The user that created the issue.

fields.name: mentioned
fields.description: A user that's mentioned in the issue.

fields.name: labels
fields.description: A list of comma separated label names. Example: bug,ui,@high

fields.name: sort
fields.description: What to sort results by. Can be either created, updated, comments.Default: created

fields.name: direction
fields.description: One of asc (ascending) or desc (descending).Default: desc

fields.name: since
fields.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

fields.name: title
fields.description: Required. The title of the issue.

fields.name: assignee
fields.description: Login for the user that this issue should be assigned to. NOTE: Only users with push access can set the assignee for new issues. The assignee is silently dropped otherwise. This field is deprecated.

fields.name: milestone
fields.type: string or integer or null or string or integer
fields.description: The number of the milestone to associate this issue with. NOTE: Only users with push access can set the milestone for new issues. The milestone is silently dropped otherwise.

fields.name: labels
fields.type: array of strings or array of objects
fields.description: Labels to associate with this issue. NOTE: Only users with push access can set labels for new issues. Labels are silently dropped otherwise.

fields.name: assignees
fields.description: Logins for Users to assign to this issue. NOTE: Only users with push access can set assignees for new issues. Assignees are silently dropped otherwise.

fields.name: title
fields.type: string or integer or null or string or integer

fields.name: assignee
fields.description: Login for the user that this issue should be assigned to. This field is deprecated.

fields.name: state
fields.description: State of the issue. Either open or closed.

fields.name: milestone
fields.type: string or integer or null or string or integer
fields.description: The number of the milestone to associate this issue with or null to remove current. NOTE: Only users with push access can set the milestone for issues. The milestone is silently dropped otherwise.

fields.name: labels
fields.type: array of strings or array of objects
fields.description: Labels to associate with this issue. Pass one or more Labels to replace the set of Labels on this Issue. Send an empty array ([]) to clear all Labels from the Issue. NOTE: Only users with push access can set labels for issues. Labels are silently dropped otherwise.

fields.name: assignees
fields.description: Logins for Users to assign to this issue. Pass one or more user logins to replace the set of assignees on this Issue. Send an empty array ([]) to clear all assignees from the Issue. NOTE: Only users with push access can set assignees for new issues. Assignees are silently dropped otherwise.

fields.name: lock_reason
fields.description:
The reason for locking the issue or pull request conversation. Lock will fail if you don't use one of these reasons:
* off-topic
* too heated
* resolved
* spam

result.namespace_description: List user account issues assigned to the authenticated user

fields.name: filter
fields.description:
Indicates which sorts of issues to return. Can be one of:
* assigned: Issues assigned to you
* created: Issues created by you
* mentioned: Issues mentioning you
* subscribed: Issues you're subscribed to updates for
* all or repos: All issues the authenticated user can see, regardless of participation or creationDefault: assigned

fields.name: state
fields.description: Indicates the state of the issues to return. Can be either open, closed, or all.Default: open

fields.name: labels
fields.description: A list of comma separated label names. Example: bug,ui,@high

fields.name: sort
fields.description: What to sort results by. Can be either created, updated, comments.Default: created

fields.name: direction
fields.description: One of asc (ascending) or desc (descending).Default: desc

fields.name: since
fields.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

result.namespace_description: Check if a user can be assigned

fields.name: assignees
fields.description: Usernames of people to assign this issue to. NOTE: Only users with push access can add assignees to an issue. Assignees are silently ignored otherwise.

fields.name: assignees
fields.description: Usernames of assignees to remove from an issue. NOTE: Only users with push access can remove assignees from an issue. Assignees are silently ignored otherwise.

result.namespace_description: List issue comments for a repository

fields.name: sort
fields.description: One of created (when the repository was starred) or updated (when it was last pushed to).Default: created

fields.name: direction
fields.description: Either asc or desc. Ignored without the sort parameter.

fields.name: since
fields.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

fields.name: body
fields.description: Required. The contents of the comment.

fields.name: since
fields.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

fields.name: body
fields.description: Required. The contents of the comment.

result.namespace_description: List issue events for a repository

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

fields.name: labels
fields.description: The names of the labels to add to the issue's existing labels. You can pass an empty array to remove all labels. Alternatively, you can pass a single label as a string or an array of labels directly, but GitHub recommends passing an object with the labels key. You can also replace all of the labels for an issue. For more information, see "Set labels for an issue."

fields.name: labels
fields.description: The names of the labels to set for the issue. The labels you set replace any existing labels. You can pass an empty array to remove all labels. Alternatively, you can pass a single label as a string or an array of labels directly, but GitHub recommends passing an object with the labels key. You can also add labels to the existing labels for an issue. For more information, see "Add labels to an issue."

result.namespace_description: Remove all labels from an issue
Remove a label from an issue

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

fields.name: name
fields.description: Required. The name of the label. Emoji can be added to label names, using either native emoji or colon-style markup. For example, typing :strawberry: will render the emoji . For a full list of available emoji and codes, see "Emoji cheat sheet."

fields.name: color
fields.description: The hexadecimal color code for the label, without the leading #.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A short description of the label. Must be 100 characters or fewer.

fields.name: new_name
fields.description: The new name of the label. Emoji can be added to label names, using either native emoji or colon-style markup. For example, typing :strawberry: will render the emoji . For a full list of available emoji and codes, see "Emoji cheat sheet."

fields.name: color
fields.description: The hexadecimal color code for the label, without the leading #.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A short description of the label. Must be 100 characters or fewer.

result.namespace_description: List labels for issues in a milestone

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of the milestone. Either open, closed, or all.Default: open

fields.name: sort
fields.description: What to sort results by. Either due_on or completeness.Default: due_on

fields.name: direction
fields.description: The direction of the sort. Either asc or desc.Default: asc

fields.name: page
fields.description: Page number of the results to fetch.Default: 1

fields.name: title
fields.description: Required. The title of the milestone.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of the milestone. Either open or closed.Default: open

fields.name: due_on
fields.description: The milestone due date. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of the milestone. Either open or closed.Default: open

fields.name: due_on
fields.description: The milestone due date. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.
